Articles.Content: Overengineered launch vehicles. My biggest yet has placed more than 50 tons of payload on a trans-Dunian insertion. It was only supposed to put 50 tons into orbit, so the transfer stage almost didn't need to use any of its fuel.

I like to think I specialise in big interplanetary missions involving motherships and multiple landers:

But people probably remember me more for the launch vehicles and base kit.

Overengineered launch vehicles. My biggest yet has placed more than 50 tons of payload on a trans-Dunian insertion. It was only supposed to put 50 tons into orbit, so the transfer stage almost didn't need to use any of its fuel.

Would you mind giving a pic of this monstrosity?
My specialty is forgetting to add important things like batteries, solar panels and parachutes.
My speciality is forgetting to open my solar panels and running out of energy
Stations and unmanned probes.
Overengineered landers. And docking. That never gets old.

I am good at:

Hunting down Easter Eggs,

Building,

Docking,

Lifting,

Exploding,

Plane-Landing,

Plane-Crashing,

Rendezvous-Landing,

Having a good sense for the Delta-V needed.

BUT... this is all hardly acquired knowledge after 1160 hours of Gametime.
engineering spacecraft to Go places.

My speciality is sending 7+ missions to the same planet when I get a window in the hope at least a few of them make it.

Edited March 20, 2014 by Crusher8000

Explosions.... giant explosions

This.

Also, perhaps, crashing the game in interesting ways. (ever seen launch gantries fly?)

Overengineering stuff and then feeling bad for being inefficient.

Edited March 20, 2014 by Ravenchant
spelling
Building and piloting, hating on nervas and yeah, swearing at the screen in Spanish. Would post an example video if we had something like spoilers.

Overgineering stuff and then feeling bad for being inefficient.

Ditto. I keep landing on the mun with my 2nd stage instead of my lander.
Building rockets, flying rockets, running out of fuel, landing Landers and cramming stuff like parachutes, batteries, solar panels, science stuff, and RTGs.

I'm definitely a big fan of space stations

You will love this design, Kasper

http://youtu.be/j4EZ_gxnfWo
... Starting again to create a design a 'meaningful' series of missions, the craft to suit them and an overall purpose. Getting distracted while waiting for transfer windows and ... (redo from start)

My specialty is burning through a lot of lifters to accomplish nothing much. I must have launched the equivalent of Minimus in the last few days, with throwing up missions, fueling them, and then starting with kethane.

SSTO space planes and the interplanetary drives.

I also work on floating bases.
I mostly specialize in craft that fall apart on the launchpad due to terrible strutting.
Failplanes, and overengineered rockets, but not so overegineered that they include small things like batteries, parachutes, or docking ports put on correctly.
I guess SSTOs and satellites...

I find it pleasantly surprising the number of people here who are saying things like 'small', 'unmanned' rather than 'huge', 'moar boosters', 'weapons', etc. I suppose I should have expected it and the huge/moar has a certain appeal of its own but I think this thread shows that KSP players like to think more than most :-) Someone should nudge Rowsdower.
Everything except boats. And eve landers.

I favor one thing for a while, then move on to another. The only kind of craft I've not yet made is a space station or planet/ moon base. I'm not good at docking (but that's because I've not yet felt the need to go that route much). I've done boats, rovers, planes, SSTOs; as well as "traditional" rockets. I like to test and compare engines.
